basics.name: Sean Floyd
basics.label: M.Sc./B.Sc. in Computer Science, 1.5+ years experience, 2 publications, bilingual

highlights: Develop integrations with 3rd party software (Webhooks, API, deep integrations)
Design, develop, test and implement new product features

work.summary: Developed new features, maintained code, fixed bugs, participated in code review and quality assurance testing.
highlights: Designed, architected and developed a proof of concept for a new core feature, allowing users to manage their network connections from within a diagram, and a project's bill of materials.
Increased developer productivity by streamlining the code review process.
Improved performance and response time by up to 50% after discovering and fixing numerous N+1 queries.

work.summary: Designed, architected, and developed a web service to integrate with the parliament's financial system as well as an interactive phishing quiz.
highlights: Designed, developed and documented a web service, database, and dashboard for monitoring logs of the in-house financial system.
Designed, architected and developed a single page application for cyber-security awereness month.

work.summary: Developed an administration panel for low memory linux touchscreen Point Of Sale mini kiosks.
Improved and maintained a .NET web application.
highlights: Single-handedly maintained the core reviewing tool for 6 weeks.
Discovered and co-fixed issues in production data that could have led to legal liabilities for employer.
Refactored a report and achieved over 50% speedup in part due to better SQL queries.
Resolved 85% of bugs and features in the product backlog.

education.summary: Thesis-based masters, admitted with a total of $35k in scholarships and grants. Published a thesis and two papers.
Took part in the co-operative education program, leading to 4 four-month internships over the course of the diploma.

publications.name: Soft Voting Windowing Ensembles for Learning from Partially Labelled Streams
publications.summary: Short-form paper from thesis research, showcased at the ECML PKDD nfCMP 2019 workshop.

publications.name: Semi-Supervised Hybrid Windowing Ensembles for Learning from Evolving Streams
publications.summary: Thesis research: Developed an ensemble machine-learning algorithm that was roughly 160 times faster than current state of the art techniques, and achieved comparable predictive accuracy. Contributions include:
highlights: Extended drift detector to work without any labelled data
Weighted soft voting scheme for ensembles
Investigation of the limits of non-selective self-training.

publications.name: An Exploratory Study of Oral and Dental Health in Canada
publications.summary: Published a paper at the IEEE ICMLA 2017 conference. Data provided by Statistics Canada.

projects.name: Tinder machine learning app
projects.summary: Built a Tinder web app clone that interacts with the library written below. My objective is to build my own machine learning recommender system.

projects.name: Tinder API Python wrapper
projects.summary: Reverse-engineered Tinder's API and wrote a Python wrapper to interact with it.

projects.name: 1Password CLI Python wrapper
projects.summary: Built a python wrapper to implement a missing feature in 1Password: transfering documents between accounts.

projects.name: Jazzify
projects.summary: Created a website to modernize recruitment of new volunteers for the Ottawa Jazz Festival. Thousands of applicants in the 5 consecutive years it has been running.

projects.name: An Active Learning System for Text Classification
projects.summary: Honours research project: Implemented a proof-of-concept for an online active-learner to handle text-classification.
